A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Full disclosure\, I am in my 40's\, and saw every original movie in the theaters and had every single action figure when I was a kid.  I waiting in line for Episode on opening night\, only to have my dreams shattered by bad writing and direction.  In short\, I hated the prequels.  Fast forward 10 years to The Force Awakens and Rogue One\, I was thrilled to have that childhood glee re-kindled.  After seeing the Last Jedi\, I left the theater not sure how to feel.  I neither loved\, nor hated this movie.  It was just kind of a confusing mess for me.  Some of the scenes and action made me jump out of my seat\, while other sequences pulled me out of the movie in Jar-Jar groan-inducing fashion.  I understand the Rian Johnson meant to burn the original concepts of Star Wars to the ground and build anew\, but I am not quite sure if I like the final product.  I feel conflicted about this movie\, and for a lifelong Star Wars superfan\, that is not necessarily a good thing.
